From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

17.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
17.str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
17.str2: To waver, doubt, hesitate. From dis; properly, to duplicate, i.e. to waver.

18.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
18.str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
18.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

19.str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: From mathetes; intransitively, to become a pupil; transitively, to disciple, i.e. Enrol as scholar.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
19.str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
20.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To give orders (injunctions, instructions, commands). From en and the base of telos; to enjoin.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
20.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A completion, consummation, end. From sunteleo; entire completion, i.e. Consummation.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
